title: Javascript, Knockout, Bootstrap, Webpack
textArray: Date: Feb 26, 2020
Presenter: Matthew 'Gus' Schultz

title: Agenda
textArray: Introduction to Web Development Basics
Javascript
Knockout
Bootstrap
Webpack
Elite 2020 Project

title: Web Development Basics
textArray: HTML (HyperText Markup Language), CSS (Cascading Style Sheet), and Javascript form the web triangle.

title: HTML
textArray: HTML is the basic building block of a website.
HTML defines both the structure and the meaning of the page content.

HTML markup uses special elements such as ,
, , and to define page content.

title: CSS
textArray: If HTML is the building block of a website, CSS is the paint and tiling.
CSS describes how HTML markup is to be rendered on the page.
Styles can be defined by element type, element ID, element class.

title: Javascript
textArray: Javascript is an interpreted programming language that allows a webpage to have dynamic content.
Javascript is a weakly typed language that allows a lot freedom in how you implement features.
Many developers around the world have created open source libraries to aid others in more easily performing common Javascript tasks.
Javascript is not at all related to the Java programming language.

title: Knockout
textArray: Knockout is a Javascript library that provides data binding between HTML elements and Javascript objects.
Knockout utelizes the MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) design pattern.
The view is our HTML with data bindings.
The view model is the Javascript those data bindings use to update the view.
The model is the data that populates the view model.
This data is frequently stored on a server that is accessed by the view model utelizing XHR (XML HTTP Requests).

title: Knockout Observables, ObservableArrays, Computeds, and Subscriptions
textArray: Knockout relies on 3 primary data types.
Observables are single Javascript objects that can be bound to the view. When the value of an observable is changed the view is automatically updated.
ObservableArrays are an array object that the view can loop over to display multiple objects using common HTML formatting
Computed objects are a type of observable whose value is calculated from other observables. When those observables change a new value is calculated for the computed.
Subscriptions allow Javascript code to take actions when an observable, observable array, or computed object changes value.

title: Knockout Example
textArray: This is a simple example of what can be done in Knockout.
The two input boxes allow the user to modify data in the view model.
The Knockout pureComputed function in this example calculates a Full Name by combining the values of two observables to produce a new value.
This new value is accessed in the same manner as any other observable for display purposes.

title: Bootstrap
textArray: Bootstrap is a Javascript library that provides a comprehensive set of CSS styles that allow for responsive webpage design.
While the Bootstrap library does come with Javascript and CSS styles, our primary interactions with it will be done by applying class identifiers to HTML elements.
The use of Bootstrap (or similar) libraries is not a necessity, but it dramatically increases the consistancy and quality that can be put into a website rapidly.

title: Bootstrap Grid
textArray: One of the most useful features of Bootstrap is the grid layout system.
This system allows you to organize your content in a way that will be presented as you intend it across a wide variety of screen resolutions.
The two basic classes that allow this system to function are 'row' and 'col'.
Rows will always be displayed vertically.
Columns will be displayed horizontally, unless the width of the screen isn't sufficient to display all of the columns in that way. When this happens your 'col' elements will be stacked vertically.

title: Bootstrap Buttons
textArray: Bootstrap also includes styling for buttons.
There are many other styles of button in Bootstrap to explore, in addition to different ways to arrange them using groups and navigation bars.

title: Bootstrap Component Sizing
textArray: Most Bootstrap components have sizing options that allow greater control over the look and feel of your webpage.

title: Webpack
textArray: Webpack is a website compiler.
It allows the developer to organize and structure their code base in similar ways as C style projects, and easily turn that into an easy to manage web project.
Webpack is highly extensible and configurable to meet the needs of developers.

title: Webpack Configuration
textArray: Using the webpack.config.js file the developer controls the way Webpack compiles their project.
This is a very simple example of a Webpack config that includes modules for loading CSS and image files, as well as configuration settings for a development server.
The Babel Javascript library adds the ability for Webpack to convert modern Javascript syntax into Javascript that will run on legacy browsers.

title: Webpack Development Server
textArray: Webpack has an optional development server that helps with rapid prototyping.
When the development server is running, it monitors the project directory for changes, recompiles and reloads the webpage when changes are detected.
A properly configured Webpack project will work just as well on the development server as it will on the target production server.
